Exceptions¶

For resilience of client code it is important to deal with exceptions correclty. The general style of programming should be to print a message and give up when receiving an RGMAPermanentException and to try again after an RGMATemporaryException.

RGMAPermanentException¶

exception rgma.RGMAPermanentException¶

Bases: rgma.RGMAException

Exception thrown when it is unlikely that repeating the call will be successful.

RGMATemporaryException¶

exception rgma.RGMATemporaryException¶

Bases: rgma.RGMAException

Exception thrown when an R-GMA call fails, but calling the method again after a delay may be successful.

RGMAException¶

exception rgma.RGMAException¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

Exception thrown when an error occurs in the RGMA application.

getMessage()¶

Return the message associated with the exception

Returns:the message as a string
getNumSuccessfulOps()¶

Returns the number of successful operations.

Returns:the number of successful operations as an integer
